snippet: A group of top regulators gave banks around the world more time to meet rules aimed at preventing financial crises, saying they wanted to avoid damaging the economic recovery.
abstract: Group of top regulators and central bankers ease rules related to assets and give banks around world more time to meet new regulations aimed at preventing financial crisis; rules, once set to take effect in 2015, will now be gradually phased in through 2019.
lead_paragraph: A group of top regulators gave banks around the world more time to meet rules aimed at preventing financial crises, saying they wanted to avoid damaging the economic recovery.

headline.seo: Banks Win an Easing of Asset Rules
headline.main: Banks Win an Easing of Rules on Assets
